sections.title: Part A: Reading
sections.description: Read the text aloud when prompted

questions.text: The United Nations has implemented various programs to address global climate change, focusing on renewable energy adoption and sustainable development practices across member nations.
Recent technological advancements in artificial intelligence and machine learning have revolutionized how businesses approach data analysis and decision-making processes.
According to recent economic reports, small businesses have shown remarkable resilience during the post-pandemic recovery period.
Environmental scientists are conducting extensive research on the impact of microplastics in marine ecosystems.
The integration of virtual reality technology in educational settings has demonstrated significant improvements in student engagement.

sections.title: Part B: Repeat
sections.description: Listen to the sentence, then repeat exactly what you hear

questions.text: The local community has organized several events to promote cultural diversity.
The research team discovered a breakthrough in renewable energy technology.
The university library will be closed for renovations next week.
Please remember to submit your assignments before the deadline.
The conference call has been rescheduled to tomorrow morning.

sections.title: Part C: Short Answer Questions
sections.description: Listen to each question and give a short answer (20 seconds)

questions.text: What would you do if you found a lost wallet on the street?
How do you usually spend your weekends?

sections.title: Part D: Sentence Builds
sections.description: Put the words in order to make a sentence

questions.solution: I went to the store yesterday
She is currently studying at the university

sections.title: Part E: Story Retelling
sections.description: Listen to a story and retell it in your own words

questions.text: Listen to a short story about a community project...
Listen to a short story about a scientific discovery...

sections.title: Part F: Open Questions
sections.description: Express your opinion on the given topic (60 seconds)

questions.text: What do you think are the most important qualities of a good leader?
How do you think technology will change education in the next decade?

sections.title: Part G: Situation Response
sections.description: Listen to each situation and respond appropriately

questions.text: Your colleague seems stressed about an upcoming presentation. What would you say?
A customer is complaining about a delayed service. How would you respond?

sections.title: Part H: Sentence Completion
sections.description: Complete the sentence with an appropriate word or phrase

questions.text: The weather forecast predicts heavy...
Before leaving for work, she always...
questions.solution: checks her email/has breakfast/locks the door
